ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Derived_part_view_definition_relationship is a type of . A Derived_part_view_definition_relationship is a relationship that relates two Part_view_definitions where one is the master, and the other is a derivation of the Master. The
in the role of relating_view is the Master.

for the Derived_part_view_definition_relationship.

for the Derived_part_view_definition_relationship.

Each
that references the Derived_part_view_definition_relationship.related_view shall reference one or more
that reference the Derived_part_view_definition_relationship.relating_view.

The
shall not be populated.

into the model of a feature using a transformation. The interpretation of the associated_connection_zone_shape_definition shall be that it shall be a shape representation for the
in the role of associated_usage.

specifies the
that is the target in the coordinate system of the model for the Usage_view_connection_zone_terminal_shape_relationship, including any transformation required.

that is the source shape for the Usage_view_connection_zone_terminal_shape_relationship.

that is the model shape for the Usage_view_connection_zone_terminal_shape_relationship.

ext_description.p: The associating_terminal_shape shall not be the associated_connection_zone_shape_definition.

The reference to a Part_feature_template_shape_model by a

The

ext_description.p:
A Part_feature_template_definition is a type of . A Part_feature_template_definition is a template for one or more features of one or more part. The properties are provided by the
on the
supertype.
ext_description.note: A Part_feature_template_definition is not interpreted as a view of a product.
ext_description.example:
A "J lead"
may be defined once using Part_feature_template_definition and re-used many times.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the identifier that distinquishes the Part_feature_template_definition.
specifies a set of Surface_conditions that may be applied to the Part_feature_template_definition.
The id shall be unique within a population of Part_feature_template_definitions.

A Part_usage_view is a type of . A Part_usage_view specifies sufficient detail to allow the application of a part in an assembly but without sufficient detail to permit reproduction of the part. The version attribute inherited from
need not reference the same product version referenced by the design view that references this view in the role of usage view. Support is provided for explicitly modeling connectors to be represented in the usage view so as to take advantage of common geometric modeling patterns. Only a member of may be associated as a component in a Part_usage_view, and then only in the and .
The product information provided in this part of ISO 10303 for a Part_usage_view is much less than that necessary to design, manufacture, or verify its performance by extracting data from the product model structure.
It is the responsibility of the design organization to create and maintain the mapping between the usage view and the design view. As the design evolves to meet the requirements, the design view will reference different versions than the usage view.
The usage view and design view of product may have two instances of a connector with perhaps differing levels of detail. In this case, the design organization may wish to keep track of the relationship between the connector in the usage view and the connector in the design view by populating a member of for each connector in the usage view.
In a drawing based exchange, an interface control drawing would contain the same information found in a usage view. Industry standards describing the information represented by interface control drawings could migrate to computer interpetable standards exchange using this standard.
Terminals are defined only in the usage view of an item in this part of ISO 10303.
Functional block diagrams for Part_usage_view that are model based, and, thus, computer interpretable, may be provided by using the Functional assignment to part module, ISO 10303-1674.
Examples of information provided in a Part_usage_view include outline shape, simplified connector models and location and orientation of those models, terminal identification, package orientation features, mounting features, interface models, pin mapping.
an attribute evaluates to this Part_usage_view.
A Part_feature_make_from_relationship is a type of . A Part_feature_make_from_relationship associates two , one of which has been reused from an existing made from part.

an inherited attribute shall be of type
for the Part_feature_make_from_relationship.

an inherited attribute shall be of type
for the Part_feature_make_from_relationship.

specifies the
for the Part_feature_make_from_relationship.
The reusable_feature shall not be the resultant_feature.

The referenced by the reusable_feature shall not be the
referenced by the resultant_feature within a population of Part_feature_make_from_relationship.
The combination of reusable_feature and resultant_feature shall be unique within a population of Part_feature_make_from_relationships.

ext_description.p:
A Part_feature is a type of
that is in the context of a . A Part_feature may be distinguished by its shape or distinguished by its location and orientation or distinguished by its identifier.
ext_description.note: A Part_feature is a distinctive aspect of a part that partially supports the choice of that part in the design.

A Part_feature inherits a unique constraint from
that maintains uniqueness of the identifier of a feature within a view. In some cases, only the uniqueness of that feature is what distinguishes it from other features. In those cases, the uniqueness constraint effectively creates a one to one and onto mapping between the location of the feature model in the geometric model of the part and the feature identifier. This mapping allows applications that do not use geometric models to be assured of model integrity.

This part of ISO 10303 does not support identification of a part feature within the context of a part by its shape classification. ISO 10303-1707 provides predefined shape classification for part features in a limited context, but the shape classification does not override feature identification support provided by this part of ISO 10303.
ext_description.example:
One ball in a Ball Grid Array style part may be distinguishable from other balls in the array only by its location in the case that a geometric model is provided. In the case that a geometric model is not provided, it may be distinguished only by its unique identifier
inherited from
in the context of the part view.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: specifies the role of the for the Part_feature. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the for the Part_feature. The value of this attribute need not be specified.
specifies the for the targeted Part_feature.

an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Part_feature is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Part_feature as its . There shall be zero or more Usage_concept_usage_relationships for a Part_feature.

an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Part_feature is dependent on the existence of the
that specifies the Part_feature as its . There shall be zero or one for a Part_feature.
If precedent_feature exists then Part_feature shall not participate either directly or indirectly in a cyclic relationship by means of precedent_feature and subsequent_feature.

The
shall not be populated.
The graph of precedent_feature shall not be cyclic.

ext_description.p:
A Connection_zone_in_usage_view is a type of
that is in the context of a . A Connection_zone_in_usage_view is included in a usage view definition to provide an explicit geometric model of the limited areas in the domain of a terminal that are allowed for a valid connection. If the usage view definition contains no limitations on the connection area of the terminals associated with the usage view definition, this Application Object shall not be provided.
ext_description.note: In some less detailed usage views, the entire point domain for features designated as terminals is considered to be available for connection, and the Connection_zone_in_usage_view is redundant.

In the case where the connection area is necessary, the application shall be carefully reviewed to determine the necessity for design instances of the connection area as in most cases, simply using the connection area as a constraint on the allowed location of a joint is sufficient.

The level of detail included in a usage view definition may be classified by a user-defined classification system which is supported by this part of ISO 10303 but this part of ISO 10303 does not predefine a classification system for usage view definition detail level.
